about.heading: About us
about.description:
Oasis mission is to provide the best and most trusted entry point to deploy your capital. We are building Oasis.app to let our users benefit from all of the potential in DeFi.

 Our team is made of passionate thinkers and builders.

warnings.potential-generate-amount-less-than-debt: Minimum Dai required to open a Vault is {{debtFloor}}. Please add more collateral to generate {{debtFloor}} Dai
warnings.debt-is-less-than-debt-floor: Your current Dai debt is below the minimum of {{debtFloor}}. Because of this some Vault actions are not possible. Please generate more Dai to take you above the minimum or payback all your debt
warnings.vault-will-be-at-risk-level-danger: With this action your vault will be at a collateralization ratio very close to the minimum required
warnings.vault-will-be-at-risk-level-danger-at-ne: With this action your vault will be at a collateralization ratio very close to the minimum required at the next price update
warnings.vault-will-be-at-risk-level-warning: With this action your vault will be at a collateralization ratio near the minimum required
warnings.vault-will-be-at-risk-level-warning-at-n: With this action your vault will be at a collateralization ratio near the minimum required at the next price update

errors.deposit-amount-exceeds-collateral-balanc: You cannot deposit more collateral than the amount in your wallet
errors.generate-amount-exceeds-dai-yield-from-t: The collateralization ratio for this Maker Vault is too low. Please generate less Dai
The collateralization ratio for this Maker Vault is too low at the next price update. Please generate less Dai
errors.generate-amount-exceeds-debt-ceiling: You are trying to generate more than the current debt ceiling allows. The amount of Dai that can be generated is {{maxGenerateAmount}}
errors.generate-amount-less-than-debt-floor: This vault type requires a minimum of {{debtFloor}} Dai to be generated. Read more about the Minimum Vault Debt <0>here</0>.
errors.payback-amount-exceeds-dai-balance: You cannot payback more Dai than the amount in your wallet
errors.payback-amount-exceeds-vault-debt: You are trying to payback more than your Dai debt for this Maker Vault
errors.debt-will-be-less-than-debt-floor: The Maker Vault debt amount either must be 0 or exceed {{debtFloor}} amount of Dai. Please change your payback amount
errors.custom-collateral-allowance-amount-excee: Allowance too large. Please decrease custom allowance amount
errors.custom-collateral-allowance-amount-less-: You need at least an allowance of your deposit amount to continue
errors.custom-dai-allowance-amount-exceeds-maxu: Allowance too large. Please decrease custom allowance amount
errors.custom-dai-allowance-amount-less-than-pa: You need at least an allowance of your payback amount to continue
errors.depositing-all-eth-balance: You need some ETH to pay for the gas fees. Lower your deposit amount
errors.ledger-enable-contract-data: Please enable Contract data on the Ledgers Ethereum app Settings
errors.withdraw-collateral-on-vault-under-debt-: You cannot withdraw from your vault while it is below the minimum required of {{debtFloor}} Dai. To withdraw your collateral, payback your debt fully. Learn more about the Minimum Vault Debt <0>here</0>.
errors.exchange-error: Could not fetch exchange prices for doing this multiply action.
errors.has-to-deposit-collateral-on-empty-vault: There is no collateral in this vault. Please first add collateral in the 'Other actions' tab, with the 'deposit collateral' action
errors.deposit-collateral-on-vault-under-debt-f: You cannot deposit to your vault while it is below the minimum debt required of {{debtFloor}}. To add more collateral, generate Dai to get above the minimum required. Learn more about the Minimum Vault Debt here <0>here</0>)

card.collateralization-ratio-calculated: Your collateralization ratio is calculated by: value of your collateral / Dai debt.
card.collateralization-ratio-description: The price used to calculate the value of your collateral is the price obtained from the Maker oracles. Your collateralization ratio needs to be above the minimum required at all times to not get liquidated.
card.collateralization-ratio-next-price: Your collateralization ratio on the next price will be:
card.collateral-locked-amount: The total amount of collateral locked in your vault is:
card.collateral-locked-USD: The total value in dollars of the collateral in your vault is:
card.collateral-locked-oracles: We use the current price from the Maker oracles to calculate this value. The current market price of your collateral may differ from this price.

tooltip.vaultId: The Vault ID is a unique reference for your Maker Vault in Oasis.app.
tooltip.stabilityFee: The Maker Protocol collects a Stability Fee on Dai that is generated from Maker Vaults. It is a variable-rate fee that changes when Maker’s governing body votes on proposals put forth by Risk Teams.
tooltip.liquidationFee:
If your vault is liquidated, a liquidation penalty is added to your vault’s total outstanding debt in Dai, which results in more collateral being sold to cover the outstanding debt. This is done to incentivize vaults owners to avoid liquidation.
The size of the liquidation penalty is determined by the Liquidation Fee which is calculated based on the debt in the vault.
tooltip.min-collateral: This is also called the Liquidation Ratio. If the Vault reaches below the minimum collateralization level it is considered undercollateralized and is subject to liquidation. Your collateral will then be partially auctioned off to cover outstanding debt and liquidation fee.
tooltip.dust-limit: The Dust Limit specifies the minimum amount of DAI that can be minted for this type of Vault. This value is also called the "Debt Floor".

card.liquidation-price-description: The Liquidation Price specifies the collateral price where your vault is subject to liquidation. If you think your vault is too close to liquidation price you can change your multiply vault to have a higher collateralization ratio, you can add more collateral on your own, or you can pay back some of your Dai debt.
card.liquidation-percentage-below: That is {{percentageBelow}} below the current price
card.buying-power-description: This is how much DAI you can use to buy more collateral right now. Buying Power specifies the maximum of Dai you can buy more collateral with based on the current state of your position. It is calculated by taking the maximum DAI available to you, using it to purchase more collateral, and locking the collateral back into the vault.
card.current-price-description: This is the current price of your vault collateral supplied by the Maker price oracles. There is a one hour delay before the oracle price is made current in the Maker Protocol.
card.next-price-description:
Here you can see the next price that will go into effect in the Maker Protocol. Compare this with the Liquidation Price to see whether your vault will be liquidated on the next price update.
{{nextPrice}}
card.more-info-oracles: More information on Maker oracles can be found <0>here</0>
card.net-value-description:
The Net Value is calculated as the current value of the collateral in your vault minus the current debt.
Note: This will not be exactly equal to the amount you will receive if you close your vault to Dai. This is due to fees applied when swapping collateral to Dai. The Net Value is calculated using the market price for the collateral using 1Inch.
card.deposit-collateral-on-vault-under-debt-f: You cannot deposit to your vault while it is below the minimum debt required of {{debtFloor}}. To add more collateral, generate Dai to get above the minimum required. Learn more about the Minimum Vault Debt here <0>here</0>)

notice-privacy: By using our site you agree to our <0>Cookie Policy</0>.
onramp-leave-message: By clicking buy, you will leave Oasis and be redirected to a third party website where you will complete the buy process.

headers.noVaults: Select a collateral type to create a Maker Vault and borrow Dai or buy additional collateral.
headers.withVaults: Open a new Maker Vault.<0/> Borrow Dai or buy additional collateral.

headers.notConnected-noVaults: {{address}} currently has no Maker Vaults.<0/> Connect your wallet and open a vault.
headers.notConnected-withVaults: Maker Vaults overview of {{address}}.<0/> Connect your wallet.

vaults-overview.subheader-no-vaults: Open a Maker Vault, deposit your collateral, and borrow Dai or buy additional collateral against it.

ownership.subheader1: Please connect your wallet to open, manage or view your Vaults.

liquidating.header1: Your {{ collateral }} Maker Vault {{ id }} is about to get liquidated.
liquidating.header2: {{ collateral }} Maker Vault {{ id }} is about to get liquidated.
liquidating.subheader1: The next price update of {{ collateral }} will cause a liquidation on this Maker Vault unless collateral is added, or Dai is paid back.
liquidating.subheader2: Is this your Maker Vault? Please connect with address: {{ address }} and save your Maker Vault from liquidation.
liquidating.subheader3: This Vault is now available for liquidation and can be liquidated at anytime.

liquidated.subheader1: This Maker Vault has been liquidated. A portion of your collateral has been auctioned to pay back your Dai debt.
liquidated.subheader3: This Maker Vault has been liquidated. A portion of collateral has been auctioned to pay back the Dai debt.
liquidated.subheader4: If this is your vault, connect with address: {{ address }} to reclaim the remaining collateral.

header.multiply-transition: Multiply your exposure on {{token}} in your vault

subtext.collateral: Deposit or withdraw from your Vault. Save gas by combining transactions.
subtext.dai: Generate DAI from the collateral in your vault, or payback DAI. Save gas by combining transactions.
subtext.edit: Simulate your vault by configuring the amount of collateral to deposit, and slide your multiply factor.
subtext.proxy: With your smart proxy multiple actions can be performed in one transaction for your Vault. This proxy only needs to be set up once.
subtext.allowance: Specify an allowance to set a maximum on the amount of tokens the vault contracts can interact with.
subtext.daiAllowance: Specify an allowance to set a maximum on the amount of tokens the vault contracts can interact with.
subtext.confirm: This will update your vault to a multiply vault. It does not require a transaction. This is a one directional change and you will not be able to switch it back to the Borrow view.
subtext.review-manage: Here you can review the details of the changes to your vault.
subtext.confirm-in-progress: Your Vault is currently being created.
subtext.modified: Your Vault is currently being updated. Please wait.
subtext.checkmark2: Adjust risk and exposure in 1 click
subtext.checkmark3: Actions like using a flash loan, and buying or selling collateral are grouped into a single transaction for greater efficiency and savings
subtext.checkmark4: You can review the details of the changes on your vault before execution
subtext.paragraph2: When you multiply your vault, you acquire collateral for funds you have borrowed against your own collateral. Make sure you understand the associated risks.

oracles.description: Below the current and next prices of the collateral types that are accepted for Maker vaults can be viewed. Most use the Oracle Stability Module (OSM). This module updates the price just once every hour. Therefore, when a crash is happening, users still have an hour to react to the new price.

select-vault-type.header: What do you want to do with your {{token}}?

multiply.subtext: Create a Multiply position and get up to {{exposureMultiplier}}x exposure on your {{token}}

borrow.subtext: Borrow up to {{maxBorrow}} DAI for every $100,000 worth of {{token}}
